reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are just back from our trip to Ghana where we spent 2 nights at the Beyin Beach resort.
reviews.title: Beautiful Location but a bit run down

reviews.text: Initially we were really impressed with the room, the outlook and the beach but on closer inspection the rooms were a bit run down. The fan didn't stay on until we jammed a hair pin into the button, the bathroom was a bit worse for wear and the bed linen and curtains were covered in stains that looked like palm oil. That said everything was very clean and comfortable. The bed was enormous!
reviews.title: It's not luxury, but it's the best place where you can stay

reviews.text: The location is stunning, we had the beach to ourselves and enjoyed an afternoon there. The girl who works on reception is so friendly and helpful and the food was delicious.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.text: We enjoyed the trip to the stilt village and ate at the Spanish restaurant next to where the canoes leave from (highly recommended) and overall had a great time.
reviews.title: Very Relaxing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Another downside which we expected was the journey to get there, heading back to Takrodi there was no direct tro tro so we ended up taking two shared taxis and a tro tro. But our trip was still worth it
reviews.title: Best place I have ever stayed in Ghana
